searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: This Technology Building Block (TBB) does...

searchDocs.title: What's Included​
searchDocs.content: This TBB contains the following resources:  Sample Projects: Pre-configured code sample for common use case.Hardware Design Files / PCBs: Design files for the hardware components (e.g., schematic diagrams, PCB layouts).Training Content: Tutorials and training materials to help you understand the key concepts.User Manuals: Detailed guides on how to use the TBB, including setup and integration instructions.Application Notes: Additional notes providing insights into specific aspects of the solution.Lab Guides: Hands-on exercises and examples to deepen your understanding of the solution.Slide Decks: PowerPoint presentations for educational or pitch purposes.

searchDocs.title: Getting Started​
searchDocs.content: To get started with this TBB, follow the steps below:

searchDocs.title: 1. Prerequisites​
searchDocs.content: Hardware Requirements: List of the hardware needed to implement the TBB (e.g., specific Renesas MCU/MPU boards, peripherals, etc.). Software Requirements: Required software tools, such as compilers, IDEs, and any Renesas-specific tools (e.g., Renesas e2 studio, etc.). Libraries and SDKs: Any libraries or SDKs that need to be installed to use this TBB.

searchDocs.title: 2. Setup Instructions​
searchDocs.content: Step-by-step guide to setting up the environment and running the provided projects. Download Contents You can do this at the bottom of this page.Install Dependencies: Use the following command(s) to install required libraries and tools. <installation command> Load the Hardware Design: Open the provided hardware design files in your preferred EDA tool (e.g., Altium).Build and Flash the Sample Code: Instructions on compiling and flashing the sample project onto the hardware.

searchDocs.title: 3. Run the Proof of Concept (PoC)​
searchDocs.content: Provide a simple guide to run the PoC, including:  Connecting the hardwareRunning the code on the target deviceVerifying expected output or behavior

searchDocs.title: Architecture Overview​
searchDocs.content: Provide a high-level description of the solution’s architecture and the key components involved. maybe some diagrams.

searchDocs.title: Folder Structure​
searchDocs.content: PROJECT/ - Contains the source code and hardware design files where applicable.COLLATERAL/ - Documentation, guides, training materials and tutorials.Any more?

searchDocs.title: Version 1.0.0 - <Release Date>​

searchDocs.title: Download​
searchDocs.content: Download the project contents here!

searchDocs.title: 🧩 What is a TBB?​
searchDocs.content: A TBB (Technology Building Block) is a curated bundle of technical collateral crafted to help customers accelerate solution development using Renesas MCUs.  Address a market or segment  TBBs captivate a solution designed to be (for own project ... ) , reusable project assets, and solution blueprints that reduce development friction and improve time-to-market.

searchDocs.title: 🎯 Objectives of a TBB​
searchDocs.content: Expand Reach — Bring Renesas technology to new global markets. Stand Out — Offer differentiated and relevant technical solutions. Build Loyalty — Deliver value and maintain customer engagement. Empower Teams — Give engineering a path to impact product and business outcomes.

searchDocs.title: 📦 What's Inside a TBB?​
searchDocs.content: Each TBB may include:  ✅ Proof of Concept (PoC) 🧑‍💻 Sample Projects 🛠️ Hardware Design Files / PCBs 🧠 Training Content 📚 User Manuals 🗃️ Application Notes, Lab Guides, Slide Decks

searchDocs.title: 🧭 TBB Lifecycle Flow​
searchDocs.content: Here's a visual breakdown of how a TBB is created, from request to public release:  graph TD A["TBB Request (OFJ)"] --> B["AE Mgmt Review"] B --> C{"TBB Author Assigned?"} C -->|No| Z["Request Rejected or Redirected"] C -->|Yes| D["Create APPENG JIRA Ticket"] D --> E["Develop Content in GitLab"] E --> F["Submit Merge Request for Release"] F --> G["TBB Available to Customers"]

searchDocs.title: 🔹 1. Request Phase​
searchDocs.content: Submitted via OFJ from roles like:  Sales FAEs BD PMM Customers  Mandatory Info:  Customer Name Device & Hardware (EVK, FPB, custom board) Feature focus Desired collateral Business case justification

searchDocs.title: 🔹 2. Triage & Assignment​
searchDocs.content: AE Managers review request Assign to appropriate Application Engineer

searchDocs.title: 🔹 3. Development​
searchDocs.content: Create APPENG JIRA Task (Label: TBB) Build project in TBB Private GitHub Repo Document deliverables and track progress using Smart Checklists, subtasks, and comments

searchDocs.title: 🔹 4. Release​
searchDocs.content: Submit Pull Request into main Auto-mirror to Public Repo External contributions (fixes, updates) accepted via PRs

searchDocs.title: 🧰 Repository Structure​
searchDocs.content: TBB Public Repo ├── MCU/ │ ├── <TBB_NAME>/ │ │ ├── README.md │ │ ├── PROJECT/ │ │ └── COLLATERAL/ └── MPU/

searchDocs.title: 📚 TBB Projects​
searchDocs.content: Browse TBBs by family:

searchDocs.title: 🔧 General Purpose Microcontrollers​
searchDocs.content: RA Family MCUs RX Family MCUs RL78 Family MCUs

searchDocs.title: 📡 Wireless Connectivity​
searchDocs.content: Bluetooth — Low Energy Wi-Fi — Low Power NFC — Near Field Communication

searchDocs.title: ⚙️ Motor Control​
searchDocs.content: Motor Control Solutions — MCU/MPU Based

searchDocs.title: ✅ One-time Setup​
searchDocs.content: GitHub: Use your Renesas email to join the Renesas GitHub Org Access: 📁 Private GitHub Repository 🗂️ APPENG JIRA

searchDocs.title: ✅ Per-TBB Actions​
searchDocs.content: Create a JIRA Ticket  Use APPENG Project: jira.eng.renesas.com Title format: TBB – <Project Name> Use TBB label  Develop Content  Follow private repo folder structure: <TBB_NAME>/PROJECT/, /COLLATERAL/ Use feature branches or forking  Release  Submit Pull Request → Triggers automated publish to public Public repo mirrors all content External PRs are allowed and managed by regional GitHub admins

searchDocs.title: 🧠 Tips & Tools​
searchDocs.content: ✅ Use Smart Checklists for project tasks 🧩 Track all activity via JIRA Comments 🔄 Maintain version control via GitHub

searchDocs.title: 📌 Resources​
searchDocs.content: 🗂 APPENG JIRA Portal 📁 Renesas GitHub Org (Contact Admin) 📄 Smart Checklist Templates (Internal) 💬 AE Global Teams: IoTBD Global AE Channel 🏖️ Gitlab Sandbox, for learning how to contribute to to Gitlab repositories
